title: What is the meaning of the occultic saying "Non si fa passaggio da estremo a estremo, fuorché traverso a medio" according to the philosophers and what are their beliefs about the universe, the Ternary, and medicine?
first_phrase: In the preceding text, the author discusses the secret knowledge passed down by the Philosophers that manifested the hidden qualities of material things. The author then delves into the concept of the Sacred Ternary, which constitutes the entire Universe according to number, order, and measure. In this final part of the text, the author explores the Earth's role in supporting and containing all things, as well as the importance of minerals. Notably, the author references Trismegisto's belief that the Sun is the father, the Moon is the mother, and the Wind carries the secret essence of life within the Earth.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the text emphasizes the importance of unity and simplicity in understanding the natural world, as well as the value of hidden knowledge in medicine and alchemy. While some of the concepts may be abstract or esoteric, the practical applications of these ideas can lead to a better understanding of the world around us and improved techniques for healing and transformation.
